intro: Reinwardtiodendron dubium, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by small, fleshy fruits that are edible for some animals. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
